text: William "Biff" McGuire (October 25, 1926 â€“ 2021) was an American actor. He was known for his stage roles as Woody in the 1960 revival of the musical Finian's Rainbow and played King Arthur in one of the first national tours of Camelot. McGuire starred in the episode "Number Seven, Hangman's Row" of the CBS anthology series, Appointment with Adventure. He also starred in the Alfred Hitchcock Presents episodes "The Gentleman From America" (1956), "The Hidden Thing" (1956), "Crackpot" (1957), and "Don't Interrupt" (1958, as Larry Templeton). He died in 2021 at the age of 94.William "Biff" McGuire, Two-Time Tony-Nominated Actor, Dies at 94 ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American movie actors Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors Category:Actors from New Haven, Connecticut
title: Biff McGuire
